data.title: Events
data.text:
Adur Connected

Follow the story of the railways that connected Shoreham, Southwick and Lancing to the world bringing work and wealth. Discover why the railway lines were built, who used them, and how they connect with houses on Shoreham Beach and buses on the Old Tollbridge. Take the train, bus, cycle or walk to explore the connected history of Adur.

The Lost Railway

Reina Alston and Russell Barnes talk about a successful project to create historic interactive information boards along part of the route of the Steyning Line.

Sussex Kelp Recovery Project

Local diver and environmental campaigner Eric Smith and his daughter Catrine, from Sussex Underwater will be giving a talk to Shoreham Society on 19 July 2024.

The Curate’s Vision

A talk by Jeremy Tomlinson from Lancing College about its foundation in Shoreham and 175 year history including the completion of the Chapel and the story of the Woodard Schools.

AGM and Shoreham Port Talk

The 2024 Shoreham Society Annual General Meeting will be held at St Peter’s Church Hall on West Street. After the formalities, our guest speaker will be Brian Rousell,

Director of Engineering and IT at Shoreham Port, followed by drinks and a snack. Also meet our new Journal editors and committee members.

The Adur Estuary

A talk about the birds and other wildlife relying on the protected environment of the Adur Estuary.

Shoreham Street Trees

Join us in the Shoreham Centre to explore how local people have been re-populating their streets with trees, and maybe take a leaf out of their book (sorry), by starting your own scheme where you live.

St Mary’s View Development

Alex Legendre will give a Shoreham Society talk on Zoom about her plans and ideas for the renovation and restoration of the former bank building, Chantry House, on East Street.

Let’s talk Rubbish

How to recycle as if our planet depends on it!

Rewilding an Urban Garden

Local resident and author, Gerry Maguire Thompson, will talk about his book, “Rewilding An Urban Garden: An Illustrated Diary of Nature’s Year”. The garden in question is his own here in Shoreham which has been going for a number of years and naturally attracts more and more species to it.

Unreeled – Film Arrives in Shoreham

Film Arrives in Shoreham. In the early twentieth century Shoreham Beach was the home of the British feature film. Take the opportunity to discover more with a talk from Frank Gray, film historian and retired Director of Screen Archive South.
